Onshape Assembly, I’m using the MKcad/FRCDesignLib kraken X60 model, with the mounting mate connectors, but when I replicate it, it says “Invalid Mate to be Matched.”  Does anybody know how to fix this?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-05-29T17:14:56.281Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":26,"reads":204,"readers_count":203,"score":170.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":502551,"topic_slug":"onshape-replicate-error-invalid-mate-to-be-matched","display_username":"Calvin kraken X60 is an assembly, and the mate connector is attached to the assembly itself, not the motor part. When you copy or replicate it, you have to select the subassembly in the instance list instead of the part in the graphics area. Just clicking the part in the graphics area will select the part and not the whole assembly, which is probably why it’s erroring. Let me know if it still doesn’t work when you select the whole kraken subassembly instead.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-05-29T17:45:04.126Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":68.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":502551,"topic_slug":"onshape-replicate-error-invalid-mate-to-be-matched","display_username":"Kelly","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54735,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1778 doesn’t work when the whole subassembly is selected, but it does work when I use a non-explicit mate connector.  the issue is that this doesn’t preserve the mate when simplifying/unsimplifying.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThank you so much for the quick reply!\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eEdit:  After testing, I’ve determined that replicates don’t work for any mates using a mate connector created in an assembly.
